text: Henry Leavenworth (December 10, 1783 â€“ July 21, 1834) was an American soldier. He was active in the War of 1812 and early military actions against the Plains Indians. He created Fort Leavenworth in Kansas. Leavenworth, Kansas, Leavenworth County, Kansas, and the Leavenworth Penitentiary are named after him. ==References== ==Other websites== * 1st Dragoons Category:1783 births Category:1834 deaths Category:Military people from Connecticut Category:19th- century American politicians Category:People from New Haven, Connecticut Category:Politicians from Connecticut
title: Henry Leavenworth
